newsitem.title: ITALY: ALPINE SKIING-ITALY'S TOMBA TO KEEP SKIING.
newsitem.headline: ALPINE SKIING-ITALY'S TOMBA TO KEEP SKIING.

text.p: World and Olympic skiing champion Alberto Tomba, brushing aside questions about his future, said on Saturday he still hungered for victory and would compete for one more season.
"In April, after winning (two world championship golds) in Sierra Nevada (Spain), I had decided to quit skiing," the Italian told a news conference.
"I felt too much stress and pressure and after making it to the top it's hard to find the motivation to move on.
"But then just before summer I changed my mind. I woke up one morning and told myself: I can still give it a try."
Tomba, 29, who has three Olympic golds and two Olympic silvers, said he might race again at a World Cup event in Vail, Colorado, in November.
"I will only ski when I feel up to par physically," he said.
"But I shall continue and I want a medal at Sestriere," he added, referring to his favourite venue, the Italian resort of Sestriere where the 1997 world championships will be held.
